channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple Opens Tap-to-Pay to Competitors, but Can They Take Advantage?
item.description: Payment companies and banks might be able to vie for more digital checkouts in stores.

item.title: My ‘evil uncle’ asked me to pay $20,000 in legal fees for his late brother’s estate. How should I respond?
item.description: “His lawyer sent me a ‘refunding bond’ and ‘release form.’”

item.title: The Extreme Renters Who Own Nothing, Not Even Their Jeans
item.description: It’s not just leasing your car. Christmas trees, camping gear and even caskets are up for rent.

item.title: ‘I want so badly to help her’: My girlfriend made a $60,000 ‘error of judgment’ at work. Should I take out a HELOC or dip into my 401(k) to bail her out?
item.description: “If she doesn’t repay the money, she believes she will lose her $100,000 job and possibly be sued for the $60,000.”

item.title: The Score: Starbucks, Trump Media, Victoria's Secret and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: The Score is a weekly review of the biggest stock moves and the news that drove them.

item.title: ‘He’s taunting me’: I loaned my son $30,000 to buy a house in 2012. I need it back. He says ‘the five-year window’ for repayment has closed. What can I do?
item.description: “I live off a modest pension and Social Security. I love my house, but it needs upgrading.”

item.title: Stocks Rebound to Notch Best Week of 2024
item.description: A streak of encouraging economic reports buoys markets; H&R Block stock a standout.

item.title: Dow 150,000? It could happen if the 2020s turn out like the Roaring ’20s.
item.description: A replay of the 1920s bull market would be something to celebrate. But hold the Champagne.

item.title: Gold Prices Set New Record on U.S. Rate-Cut Hopes, Geopolitical Concerns
item.description: Continuous gold futures on the New York Mercantile Exchange reached as high as $2,538.7 earlier in the session, breaking the prior record of $2,522.5.

item.title: How to invest so volatility doesn’t mess with your financial security
item.description: Take the long view and manage your debt.
